The failure in "CodeQL / Analyze (cpp) (pull_request_target)" is at "Build libnl".
```
HEAD is now at 7b167ef8 libnl-3.5.0 release
Switched to a new branch 'sonic'
error: patch failed: lib/route/route_obj.c:1201
error: lib/route/route_obj.c: patch does not apply
stg import: Diff does not apply cleanly
Error: Process completed with exit code 2.
```
@prsunny patch including lib/route/route_obj.c is in branch master (https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/blob/master/src/libnl3/patch/0003-Adding-support-for-RTA_NH_ID-attribute.patch), not 202405. Is this jenkins issue?
@bingwang-ms to check if this can be included in 202405
@prsunny @kperumalbfn The Azure Pipelines started 5 days ago and is still running. Is there something stuck at pipeline?

@VladimirKuk any idea if those test failures are actually a symptom of the patch itself?  Or is it just common for things to fail in the tests from time to time?

Tests do fail from time to time.
At least to me, these tests are unrelated to the change.
@prsunny please review

Thank you for pushing this forward!
For the record, we've been running these changes in production for ~2 years without issues, so I'd be quite confident that they work as expected.
@prsunny ping
@VladimirKuk I ended up having to sprinkle your suggestion in 2 places to get it fully working.
@prsunny how would you like to proceed on this?  I think this is a critical issue since community SONiC doesn't support ARP/ND suppression so things just don't work at all without this.

@prsunny figured out the test case failure and corrected it, it was due to specifically checking tunnel attributes and we added 2 new ones.
@abdosi, @judyjoseph, @srj102 any review comments?  This is a pretty large blocker for VXLAN EVPN
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).
@prsunny @dgsudharsan @srj102 any further feedback here?  I'd really like to get this merged.  There are lots of people using this patch already.

@bradh352 Thanks for the fixes. 

By keeping the create_tunnel helpers default values we are not impacting the other orchs like nvgre/srv6/tunneldecap.
The latest change you made is fine. 

vnetorch also keeps the VXLAN tunnel created in the PIPE mode and hence we should be able to go with PIPE mode for BGP EVPN vxlan tunnels.

> @bradh352 Thanks for the fixes.
> 
> By keeping the create_tunnel helpers default values we are not impacting the other orchs like nvgre/srv6/tunneldecap. The latest change you made is fine.
> 
> vnetorch also keeps the VXLAN tunnel created in the PIPE mode and hence we should be able to go with PIPE mode for BGP EVPN vxlan tunnels.

Can you mark it as approved?

Also, I recently acquired a Mellanox Spectrum1 switch (SN2201) for testing and can confirm this patch also works on that ASIC.

In both cases, for 70 LAGs, it took about 0.6-0.7 seconds to send SIGTERM to the teamd processes, but the distribution of SIGTERMs sent is different. However, on this device, there are still some netlink messages getting dropped resulting in the cleanup not being complete.
@saiarcot895  Can you please run your changes with test_po_cleanup and test_po_cleanup_after_reload? We are noticing these tests statically fail with your changes
@saiarcot895  Do we have an updated fix?

SIGTERM signal to the teamd supervisord was sent at 07:41:40, and the container exited at 07:41:46.

Teamd container is also configured to have a 60-second wait time (instead of the 10-second wait time) for termination, meaning docker will wait 60 seconds for the container to go down before forcefully killing it. This means that a 6-second wait time here is fine.
